q: While building an Angular app, you have used a lot of filters to optimize your application. Which of the following is NOT a type of filter?

You are creating an app using Angular. You have taken the details of all the products of a particular brand, for which you are building the app. Now, you want to add a filter to sort the product according to their prices.
What type of filter will you use? Also, select the code section which fulfills the above condition.

Options

  1. You will use orderBy filter.
    <ul>
    <li ng-repeat = "company in product.products | orderBy:'price">
     {{ company.product + ', price:' + product.price }}
     </li>
    </ul>
  2. You will use number filter.
    <ul>
    <li ng-repeat = "company in product.products | number:'price">
     {{ company.product + ', price:' + product.price }}
     </li>
    </ul>
  3. You will use orderBy filter.
    <ul>
    <ul ng-repeat = "company in product.products | orderBy:'price">
     {{ company.product + ', price:' + product.price }}
     </ul>
    </ul>
  4. You will use the currency filter.
    <ul>
    <li ng-repeat = "company in product.products | currency:'price">
     {{ company.product + ', price:' + product.price }}
     </li>
    </ul>

Alice was working on filtering operations in Android. Alice wants to terminate the previous non-executed filtering requests and wants to create a new filtering request. So she executed the following commands from java.lang.Object package. Which of the following statements about the commands is true?

 

Statements:

  1. The filter class is an abstract class.
     
  2. Calling the following method performs filtering operations asynchronously- 
    public final void filter (CharSequence constraint)

     

  3. The following method starts a synchronous filtering operation-

    public final void filter (CharSequence constraint, Filter.FilterListener listener)
